title: "You use squishy, easy to burst top laners, and that's why you hate and cry about Riven"
body:
I am a top laner main.

Four of my favorite top laners are {{champion:8}}, {{champion:105}}, {{champion:120}}, and{{champion:31}}.

None of them are squishy at all. Vlad gains HP with his passive and he generally buy tanky AP items such as Liandry and Rylai. Fizz is not naturally tanky but he can be tanky when built AD. Hecarim is naturally tanky and that is unquestionable. Cho'Gath, well... has his ult.

There are also many other non-squishy top laners that I like to use, and they are actually the majority of the top laners I use: {{champion:98}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:48}} and more recently I am starting to use {{champion:223}} as a top laner.

That said, I still think that Riven should be changed. She is way too powerful, and I say that despite playing tanky champions who are supposed to beat her.

They are just supposed. On theory, tankyness should counter Riven. But the problem is that items like {{item:3035}}, {{item:3134}}, and {{item:3071}} negate a lot of that tanykness. A good Riven will always rush those items if they notice that the enemy is stacking armor. It is always the same thing, for example, when I play Shen. I even start with armor quints; and win trades against Riven. But the moment she has Last Whisper, I can no longer win trades against her, no matter how much armor I have.

When people think about Riven, they say "burst damage" but Riven actually has a lot of sustained damage, enough to deal with many bruisers and tanks. This is because of her Q and her passive, if executed with animation cancelling. She will never kill a tank/buiser as fast as she can kill a squishy, but she can, and will negate their damage with her shield. Keep in mind that by purchasing armor/HP, you are sacrificing damage. If you don't actually have the damage to kill Riven before she kills you, then it doesn't matter how much armor you stack, she will kill you regardless.

That's why I like to play {{champion:54}} against Riven, even though he is not one of my favorite top laners. He is one of the best because not only he gains even more armor the more armor you stack, but his offensive abilities actually scale with armor, allowing his damage to scale and allowing him to actually have enough damage to deal with Riven later. However, Malphite has other problems that make him not be the best pick against Riven. For example, apart from his ult, there isn't much that he can do to peel a Riven off a teammate. His Q is not of much help due to her dashes. And if Malphite has powerful AP champions as her allies, Malphite will have problems, since he is not very useful against mages.

I still think that Riven is too powerful and obnoxious, and that is not because she can 1-shot me. That's because no matter what I do against her, I am always feeling helpless.

{{champion:122}} Wins or loses his lane entirely by matchup, it takes a REALLY, ENORMOUS skill difference between the two players for Darius to lose a favorable matchup.

Until you hit a certain skill level that is.  Darius wins fairly consistently against lower skilled opponents, and even against quite a few higher skill opponents.  But at higher tiered levels of play he starts to fall flat.

in the case of Riven, it starts coming into play at the higher tiers of play rather than the lower tiers (yes Riven is a fairly easy champ to play, but at lower tiers of play most people do not know how to animation cancel or combo correctly and that is simply required for Riven to win lanes unless the other person she is playing against is a complete tool).  Once you get into higher tiers of play, it takes significantly more skill on your opponents part to deal with Riven unless you are playing one of her hard counters.  This is because Riven outkits most champions in the game with massive amounts of free stats, lots of mobility, 2 forms of mobility, and an execute.  Riven is also a very safe champion to play as, because she is nearly impossible to gank unless she has grossly overextended, and even then she can still end up escaping a gank if she has flash up and hasn't burned her cooldowns.

The problem with dealing with Riven is that whether you beat her or not depends on whether or not she screws up pretty significantly.  Riven always has the advantage, it is up to her to determine whether or not she keeps it.

What higher-skilled players learn about dealing with Darius is how -not- to lose lane, farm under turret and keep the score 0/0 so he can become useless later on. It has less to do with mechanics and more to do with game knowledge (Knowing how to lose a lane without it becoming a terrible weight for the rest of the team is an important skill).

Riven however is entirely dependent on -her- skill. When I play against a Riven it's not about the matchup and more about "Does this player understand ani canceling?" It's less down to my own skill. or the skill difference, but more about whether this player has mastered this particular skill or hasn't, there's no counterplay against an ani-canceling Riven than picking one of her counters.
